AppCode bug-fix update 2022.3.2 is here!

The main highlights include:

  • The code documentation works for Kotlin symbols when they are completed in Swift files (KMA-574).
  • SPM tests work as expected again (OC-23419).
  • The behavior of the Settings Sync plugin has been updated. Settings synchronization across different IDE products is now turned off by default and can be enabled via a checkbox in Preferences | Settings Sync.
  • The JetBrains Runtime team has been working to fully eliminate screen flickering in full-screen mode on macOS Ventura. It no longer occurs in most instances, though some corner cases may remain. If you continue to experience this problem, please let us know in our issue tracker (JBR-4959).

For more details, please see the release notes.

AppCode bug-fix update 2022.2.5 is here!

The main highlights include:

  • We fixed a building to device issue in Reveal integration on macOS 13.
  • We disabled compatibility warning for macOS 13.

For more details, please see the release notes.

AppCode 2022.1.4 is here!

The main highlights include:

Here are the highlights:

  • Fixed the Run Git hooks checkbox in the Before Commit section of the Commit tool window.
  • Changing the .iml file no longer removes associated Git mapping.
  • Fixed the issue causing the external diff tools for directories to malfunction.

The full release notes are available here.

The preview of Aqua is out!

Aqua is a powerful new IDE for test automation.

  • Use the embedded Web Inspector to view web applications and capture page elements required for automated tests.
  • Aqua generates a unique CSS or XPath locator for the selected element and helps add it to the source code.
  • While maintaining tests, Aqua lets you verify and edit the existing locators. Validate your CSS selector or XPath with Web Inspector and check whether the locator identified the element you want.
  • As a fully-equipped IDE, Aqua recognizes page object classes and UI tests in the source code and helps verify locators with Web Inspector.
  • Aqua also helps you set up new fully configured automation projects, with a wide range of supported frameworks and technologies. It provides a New Page Object File wizard with lots of customizable templates.
  • When developing tests, Aqua auto-completes valid CSS and Xpath locators for visible elements on the current web page.
  • Aqua provides a code-driven HTTP client and helps generate requests for the given API.
  • Manage multiple databases, develop SQL scripts, and perform low-level data assertions. Aqua requires no extra tools to prepare your application data.
  • Aqua helps you develop automated tests and boosts your productivity, whether you do UI, API, or unit testing.

Read our blog post for more details.

A new CLion 2023.1 EAP build is here!

Check out the main highlights and read the post for more details:

  • Support for vcpkg received many enhancements and fixes.
  • We introduced several CMake integration updates.
  • We fixed the clangd crash which made it impossible to show the inlay hints for push_back and emplace_back calls.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2022.3.2, is available for download!

The main highlights include:

  • Reformat on save with ClangFormat works as expected again.
  • On Windows, CLion no longer breaks the project compilation with the Visual Studio toolchain when CMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE is in use.
  • We fixed the incorrect code warning which happened for GCC toolchain on macOS.
  • Performance:
    • We improved the performance of the code analysis in CLion.
    • We improved the performance of parsing coverage results, which was slow when using remote mode.
    • For Docker toolchain, CLion now correctly captures the end of the background task execution.
  • The behavior of the Settings Sync plugin has been updated. Settings synchronization across different IDE products is now turned off by default and can be enabled via a checkbox in Settings/Preferences | Settings Sync.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2022.2.4, is available for download!

The main highlights include:

  • We've fixed several bugs in code analysis (the Unreachable code, Condition is always true, and Value is only assigned but never accessed warnings are no longer triggered incorrectly).
  • IAR language extensions are now supported in CLion.
  • Files can now be edited properly after the project has been recompiled.
  • When you develop remotely using the thin client in CLion, the JetBrains client rejoins the session after the Restart IDE action is called.
  • Performance has been improved when working with language injections.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2022.1.3, is available for download!

Here are the main highlights:

  • The Rename refactoring was fixed and is now applied to the correct code range.
  • CLion now checks for changes in the environment after every CMake reload. This way the IDE will suggest that you clean the CMake cache and reload CMake when CLion decides it's necessary.
  • Ctrl+Click (On Windows and Linux) / Cmd+Click (on macOS) in the Git Log panel now works as expected.
  • The UI issue causing a truncated VCS in-editor menu has been resolved.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2021.3.4, is available for download!

Here are the highlights:
  • Bundled LLDB on Windows was fixed to allow the debugging of Rust code
  • MSYS2 MinGW, starting with version 9.0.0.6373.5be8fcd83-2, is now supported in CLion
  • Fixed an issue with the remote SSH connection in cases where Python isn't installed on your computer or there is no python in path /usr/bin/env. This issue also caused significant performance CPU usage and a hang

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2021.2.4, is available for download!

The highlights include:

  • Fixed the Main menu so it now loads instantly.
  • Fixed the low resolution of the icons in the main menu.
  • Fixed the File mask drop-down list so it now properly displays the available masks.
  • Fixed the IDE's behavior when switching between Git branches - unexpected empty windows no longer appear.
  • Fixed a regression when opening a CMake project without an .idea folder in it.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2021.1.3, is available for download!

The highlights include:

  • Fixed red CUDA code with Visual Studio C++ toolchain.
  • Fixed the code completion in CUDA code that stopped working after including a normal C++ header file (*.h) to the CUDA files.
  • Fixed the incorrect error Use of undeclared identificator __cudaPushCallConfiguration.
  • CLion no longer shows update notifications from disabled plugins.
  • Fixed an unexpected closure of the Compare with branch dialog.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2020.3.4, is available for download!

  • In this update we've fixed an issue with Compilation Database projects that caused the Build tool window not to be displayed when a project was reloaded using the editor widget.
  • In addition, we've ported the trusted project functionality released earlier as part of CLion 2021.1.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2020.2.5, is available for download!

Here are the most notable improvements:

  • For macOS Big Sur users:
    • Fixed an issue where opening a project in a new window results in opening the project in another tab.
    • Fixed a problem causing CLion to crash after exiting sleep mode.
  • UI:
    • Fixed Find and Replace actions forgetting the size of the text area if it was changed by the user.
  • VCS:
    • The pull dialog now correctly suggests pulling from the latest entered branch instead of the tracked branch.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2020.1.3, is available for download!

Here are the key highlights:

  • An issue with selecting and running multiple CMake Google tests is fixed (CPP-20039).
  • This update introduces the Show Remote Hosts Info diagnostic action,
    which dumps some remote settings and the list of failed remote connections along with their settings.
  • It also brings fixes in the IntelliJ Platform and JetBrains Runtime.

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2019.3.6, is available for download!

Here are the key highlights:

  • C++ specific fixes:
    • A fix in Clangd which led to a crash on catch.hpp file.
    • Concepts support, introduced in v2019.3, now also works with the Microsoft Visual C++ toolchain.
  • From the IntelliJ Platform:
    • We've fixed the regression that prevented the IDE from starting if it was installed in a path with non-ASCII characters.
    • The IDE now shows the confirmation dialog when deleting a directory that is under SVN.
    • A bug is fixed with the licence server address cleared when it's unreachable.
  • The issue with displaying the context menu or main menu popups in Full Screen mode under XFCE has been fixed (JBR-2143)

For more details, please see the blog post.

A bug-fix update, CLion 2019.2.5, is available for download!

This minor release brings some fixes from the IntelliJ Platform, including several notable changes for macOS Catalina:

  • Fixed opening projects on macOS Catalina (JBR-1721).
  • Fixed font rendering in text fields on macOS Catalina (JBR-1863).

For more details, please see the blog post.

A new CLion 2019.1.4 bug-fix update is here!

Here are the key highlights:

  • If you open a project from the invalid compile_commands.json file and then fix it manually,
    CLion will now suggest to auto-reload the project for you
  • Changes in the Environment variables field of the Run/Debug Configurations are now saved correctly by the IDE
  • The font settings on Linux are now saved correctly by the IDE
  • The Find in Path dialog now closes when opening a project in the same window

For more details, please see the blog post.

DataGrip 2022.3.3 is Out!

Improvements and bug fixes

  • DBE-11963: Auto-refresh is now available with adjustable intervals. It can be disabled manually or automatically (for example, if you start editing).

    You can set up auto-refresh for sessions in Virtual views to monitor sessions in real time, which finally resolves this really old ticket, DBE-229

  • DBE-17059: A list of settings was added to the Object Migration dialog.

  • DBE-16936: The Custom color chooser for databases now works correctly.
  • DBE-17068: Execute to file now works correctly.
  • DBE-16902: [Redis] We fixed the problem with connecting when SSL is enabled. Important: Please update the Redis JDBC driver to v1.3.
  • [Oracle] We added more details related to obtaining stored object sources to the Diagnostic Refresh log. This will help us investigate problems when some object sources are not retrieved by the introspector properly.

DataGrip 2022.2.5 is Out!

Bug-fixes

  • DBE-16324: Fixed the Datagrip freezing issue that occurred due to INSERT AS SELECT queries.
  • DBE-12680: Database renaming now works correctly.
  • DBE-16462 [PostgreSQL]: Fixed the bug with incorrect max values for BIGINT identity columns.
  • DBE-15560 [Microsoft SQL Server]: INCLUDE columns are now recognized correctly.
  • DBE-16377 [PostgreSQL]: Fixed the issue with extra grant/revoke permissions.
  • DBE-15604 [Snowflake, BigQuery]: QUALIFY clause is now supported.
  • DBE-16203 [BigQuery]: Database introspection now works correctly.
  • DBE-16376 [Amazon Aurora SQL]: Many users have encountered issues when using the MariaDB 3.X driver due to a known MariaDB Connector bug. If you are still facing this problem, downgrade the driver version manually by selecting MariaDB Connector J / 2.X in the Driver Files. You may also need to restart the IDE.

DataGrip 2022.1.5 is Out!

Bug-fixes

  • DBE-14378: TiDB is now detected, and DataGrip only uses statements that are supported by the database.
  • DBE-15553: [Exasol] The IMPERSONATE command is now supported.
  • DBE-15322: [ClickHouse] Fixed type deduction for map literals.
  • [Snowflake] Added the ability to skip the table stage property introspection if it's taking too long to get the properties.
  • [PostgreSQL, Azure] Fixed the introspection problem that was occurring when several databases were selected in one data source (also fixed DBE-15360).
  • [Oracle]: Fixed Numeric Overflow in Oracle v.18 and later.

DataGrip 2021.3.4 is Out!

Fixes

  • DBE-14416 [PostgreSQL, Greenplum, Redshift]: The introspector is now more stable if errors occur.
  • DBE-10913 Synonym quick info now displays information about the target object.
  • DBE-14724 The console toolbar disappears automatically after session detach for non-SQL files.
  • DBE-11591 [PostgreSQL]: DataGrip will automatically re-run queries without CTID if it causes an error in Postgres Citus.
  • DBE-14728 [Azure] Fixed Copy Table to... when the action is invoked from the context menu or from Find Action.
  • DBE-14697 After executing the migration script, DataGrip automatically refreshes the target schema.
  • DBE-14633 The Oracle debugger now works as expected.

DataGrip 2021.2.4 is Out!

Fixes

  • DBE-13839: Directories are now attached correctly.
  • DBE-14149: [Oracle] The Driver class 'Files' not found warning is no longer falsely triggered when connecting via TNS.
  • DBE-14144: [Oracle] Fixed the bug that occurred when trying to alter a table that contained a partitioned table with an "update indexes" expression.
  • DBE-12195: [Vertica] The LIMIT OVER syntax is now supported.
  • DBE-14120: [PostgreSQL] Custom search paths inside routine definitions are now supported.

DataGrip 2021.1.3

Fixes

  • DBE-13313: Fixed the "handshake error" problem when connecting to the database.
  • DBE-13287: Code completion now works in the Modify Table even if the case doesn't match.
  • DBE-13292: [SQL Server] Extended properties are not included in the generated DDL.
  • DBE-13350: [Oracle] Introspection is compatible with version 9i.

DataGrip 2020.3.2 is Out!

Important fixes

  • DBE-12398: The problem with freezes on Test Connection is fixed.
  • DBE-12367: Athena introspection works again.
  • DBE-12168: The Submit changes immediately option is back.
  • DBE-10828: The JDBC URL is not pasted in the data source name by default.

DataGrip 2020.2.3

Important fixes:

  • DBE-11340: The username and password fields no longer disappear.
  • DBE-11156: When updating the source code, if a new version contains errors and fails to be submitted, you'll now see a prompt to restore the previous version.
  • DBE-11440: [SQL Server] Submit changes to database works again for procedures.

DataGrip 2020.1.5

Most important

  • The issue with SQL Server Authentication on Windows is fixed.

Other fixes

  • DBE-9876: Forced execution in read-only mode now runs the correct query.
  • DBE-10727: Schemas comparator respects column order.
  • DBE-10715: [PostgreSQL]: DataGrip no longer throws a time zone error for versions of PostgreSQL before 10.
  • DBE-10724: [Snowflake]: The Modify Table dialog generates valid code.

New features

  • A new quick-fix is available: Refresh schema.
  • The migration buttons now tell clearer what they actually do.
  • If you create a DDL data source, the folder with the sources will automatically be attached to the project.
  • If you try to change the DDL of the target table during the data import process, DataGrip will warn you.
  • If an Oracle database wants you to change an expired password, you can do so from the UI.

DataGrip 2019.3.5 is Out!

Important bug fixes:

  • IDEA-238386, IDEA-236342, IDEA-219779: Fixed problems with licensing.
  • DBE-10396: Errors no longer occur while creating object files in SQL Generator.
  • DBE-10371: Opening an SQL file from Explorer no longer creates a new project.

DataGrip 2019.2.6 is Out!

  • Result tabs switch with the consoles again.
  • No more freezes on MacOS Catalina when exporting data. DBE-9334
  • Fixed the bugs with the external tables in Redshift not showing. DBE-9181
  • Various bugs with paging are fixed. DBE-9217
  • Column names are no longer collapsed when the data editor is transposed. DBE-8904
  • The "column specified more than once" error does not appear for data import anymore. DBE-9283
  • The table and column comments are not truncated anymore. DBE-8000
  • There are no longer false warnings about the number of values when selecting the identity column. DBE-8924

DataGrip 2019.1.4 is Out!

Bug fixes

  • We hope that, finally, all the performance problems on startup are fixed! JBR-1393
  • The Filter History is preserved in the data editor after a restart DBE-8318
  • Boolean values can be edited when creating a new row DBE-7701
  • [Oracle] DataGrip doesn't hang when working with big packages DBE-8499
  • [Apache Ignite] Data editor now works DBE-8453

DataGrip 2018.3.4 is Out! Some bug-fixes are inside.

SQL formatter: we're still improving it!

  • DBE-4805: We keep the case of quoted identifiers in PostgreSQL.
  • DBE-6937: Better arrays formatting in PostgreSQL.
  • DBE-7362: Formatter works in SQL-injections.
  • DBE-7376: Better WITH formatting.
  • DBE-7605: Support for INTO TEMP TABLE in PostgreSQL.
  • DBE-7806: Better formatting for variables in SQL Server.
  • DBE-7881: Support for ON CONFLICT clause in PostgreSQL.
  • DBE-7890: No more line break after PERFORM in PostgreSQL.

Other

  • During data import errors are written into a file by default.
  • DBE-7838: Fixed bug with missed reference when creating a foreign key.
  • DBE-7840: Autoscroll from the editor works correctly.
  • DBE-7896: No more raw HTML in notifications.

DataGrip 2018.2.5 is Out

Fix:

– JRE-998 – stderr was cleaned from redundant output

The GoLand 2022.3.2 Is Available

This build includes several bug fixes and other improvements.

GoLand 2022.2.5 is out

The highlights:

GoLand 2022.2.5 is out with bug fixes and other improvements.

Most notably, if you use multiple monitors, the IDE window no longer goes blank when the second monitor is reconnected.

This version includes a quick-fix for grouping several use directives into one in go.work, as well as some bug fixes and improvements.

GoLand 2021.3.5 is out!

This version includes a fix for Go modules integration. The integration would stop working after you switched from a stable version to an EAP build and then back to the stable version, but now this has been fixed.

GoLand 2021.1.3 is here!

The main highlights:

  • GO-11184 — As you might know, you get a perpetual fallback license when you buy a one-year license for any of JetBrains products (except our Team Tools). This page has more details about that.
  • Now version information is more easily discoverable via Help | About (on Windows and Linux) or GoLand | About (on macOS).The previous update accidentally removed version information from that window, but now it’s back.
  • GO-10986 — You can run go check via the menu when you click the Run gutter icon in the editor as usual.

GoLand 2017.3.5 is out with a fix for freezing on macOS Mojave.

IntelliJ IDEA 2023.1 EAP 3 is out with the following updates:
  • Vertical split for tool windows in the new UI
  • New Compact Mode for the new UI
  • Merged logs from all Docker-compose containers
  • Azure Container Registry support
  • Improved UX with kubeconfig files
  • An action to create new Kubernetes Secrets
Learn more in this blog post.

IntelliJ IDEA 2022.3.2 is now available!
  • We've been working to fully eliminate screen flickering in full-screen mode on macOS Ventura. It no longer occurs in most instances, though some corner cases may remain. If you continue to experience this problem, please let us know in our issue tracker. [JBR-4959]
  • The behavior of the Settings Sync plugin has been updated. Settings synchronization across different IDE products is now turned off by default and can be enabled via a checkbox in Settings/Preferences | Settings Sync. [IDEA-233535]
  • The toolbar icons in the Remote Host tool window are now displayed correctly in the new UI. [IDEA-299612]
  • When committing via modal dialog, the process no longer freezes when additional external formatters or code analysis plugins are enabled. [IDEA-307428]
  • Search Everywhere once again works as expected, providing all text search results. [IDEA-307142]
  • The Incorrect formatting inspection no longer causes the IDE to freeze. [IDEA-308487]
  • The Kotlin plugin has been updated to version 1.8. [KTIJ-24378]
For more details, please see this blog post.

IntelliJ IDEA 2022.2.4 Is Out!
  • Changing the display layout or waking from sleep mode no longer causes corrupted text or a flashing red screen on macOS [JBR-4864].
  • The screen no longer flickers when working with the IDE in full screen mode on macOS Ventura [JBR-4959].
For more details, please refer to this blog post.

IntelliJ IDEA 2022.1.4 is here!
  • Fixed the issue causing text flickers in the Commit details pane [IDEA-284246].
  • Fixed the Run Git hooks checkbox in the Before Commit section of the Commit tool window [IDEA-264817].
  • Fixed the issue with local module recognition in the Terraform plugin [IDEA-287371].
  • Fixed the bug causing IntelliJ IDEA to crash on macOS High Sierra [IDEA-296489].
  • Fixed the issue causing the IDE to freeze on startup [IDEA-296486].
For more details, please refer to the blog post.

IntelliJ IDEA 2021.3.3 is here.
  • IntelliJ IDEA now builds and filters resources properly when working with Maven 3.8.5. [IDEA-290419]
  • Fixed an issue causing the IDE to freeze and hang when indexing WSL projects. [IDEA-286059]
  • Fixed a few issues that were appearing when working with Gradle. [IDEA-287618], [IDEA-285663]; [IDEA-284391]; [IDEA-284013]
  • Fixed the IDE's behavior on macOS when using Cmd+Shift+[ and Cmd+Shift+] to switch between Big Sur tabs [IDEA-261595]
  • Fixed the problem causing the IDE to add unexpected refs/heads prefixes when pushing to Gerrit. [IDEA-282180]
For more details, please refer to the blog post.

IntelliJ IDEA 2021.2.4 Is Out!

  • Fixed the Main menu so it now loads instantly. [IDEA-277709]
  • Fixed the low resolution of the icons in the main menu. [IDEA-283733]
  • Fixed the File mask drop-down list so it now properly displays the available masks. [IDEA-236785]
  • Fixed the results tabs so that only the intended ones respond when you close them. [IDEA-274154]

For more details please refer to the blog post.

IntelliJ IDEA 2021.1.3 is available with the following bug fixes and improvements:

  • JBR 11 was updated to 11.0.11-b1341.60.
  • Fixed the error that appears when you click Download sources for Maven projects. [IDEA-247792]
  • Fixed the problems behind several UI freezes. [JBR-2755]
  • Ctrl+Shift+Arrow keys works for text selection as it should. [IDEA-267294]
  • The IDE loads resource files in a Gradle project with module-info.java. [IDEA-197469]

For an extended list of the issues we've addressed, read our blog post.

IntelliJ IDEA 2020.3.4 is available with the following bug fixes:

  • The IDE now loads the correct version of the Maven dependency. [IDEA-255594]
  • Returned the speed of autocompletion to normal. [IDEA-264579]
  • Fixed the warning about an illegal reflective access operation. [IDEA-248785]
  • Fixed the deadlock upon generating Java code from an XML schema using JAXB. [IDEA-257312]
  • Fixed the Lombok error that would occur when a log was used in a static block.

For more addressed issues, refer to our blog post or the release notes.

IntelliJ IDEA 2020.2.4 is available with the following fixes.

For IntelliJ IDEA:

  • Fixed the formatting of Gherkin files [IDEA-251322].
  • Fixed module dependency in Gradle projects [IDEA-232283].
  • Fixed Search For Class in Maven projects [IDEA-215618].

For JBR:

  • JBR 11 has been updated to 11.0.9+11-b944.49.
  • Fixed JCEF issues involving the Markdown editor stealing focus [JBR-2866], [JBR-2872].
  • Fixed the way a new project opens on macOS BigSur [JBR-2879].
  • Fixed problem causing IntelliJ IDEA to crash after exiting sleep mode on macOS BigSur [JBR-2790].

For more information, read our blog post.

Fixes and improvements

IntelliJ IDEA 2019.3.5 is here! It brings a variety of updates and bug fixes.

  • We've fixed the regression that caused v2019.3.4 not to start when installed in a path with non-ASCII characters: IDEA-235754.
  • The IDE now shows the confirmation dialog when deleting a directory which is under SVN: IDEA-228828.
  • The Gradle daemon no longer starts with debugging enabled when debugging tests and delegating to Gradle: IDEA-235648.
  • The JBR has been updated to v11.0.6+8-b520.66.
For more details please refer to the blog post.

Fixes and Improvements

IntelliJ IDEA 2019.2.4 is available! Here's the list of improvements:

  • Improved "safe write" mode and kept the original file permissions intact IDEA-152607.
  • Fixed JavaFX Scene Builder integration IDEA-209562.
  • Fixed debugging issues with Gradle parallel execution enabled IDEA-207748.
  • Resolved the jbr/bin/java Access Denied error in IDE updates IDEA-215497.

    Read more on the blog.

JBR 11 was updated to 11.0.4+10-b304.77. Notable changes:

  • Fixed opening projects on macOS Catalina JBR-1721.
  • Fixed font rendering in text fields on macOS Catalina JBR-1863.

Bug Fixes and Improvements

IntelliJ IDEA 2019.1.4 is here with the several notable bugs fixes and
performance improvements:

  • The IDE doesn't lose the focus after escaping the "Find in Path..." dialog:
    IDEA-215107.
  • The extract method shortcut doesn't enter the µ symbol in the method name field anymore:
    IDEA-187355.
  • The issue that prevented the typing in the detached editor on macOS is fixed:
    IDEA-189984.
  • The alphabetical sorting in File Structure popup now persists after closing:
    IDEA-125108.
  • Fixed regression: it's now possible to paste the value containing equals sign
    in the environment variables: IDEA-210897.
  • Fixed performance issues: IDEA-216453, IDEA-211672, IDEA-216728.
  • JBR 8 was updated to v1.8.0_212-release-1586-b4.
  • JBR 11 was updated to v11.0.2+9-b159.64.

For more details, please refer to the blog post.

IntelliJ IDEA Edu 2022.2.2 includes the latest updates from IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition and EduTools 2022.10.

Here are the highlights:

  • Course creators can now automatically check all tasks before publishing.
  • Teachers can now customize the names of hints.
  • We've fixed the issue causing incorrect task names to be displayed in the task description.

You can find a list of all the fixes and improvements in this version in our issue tracker.

IntelliJ IDEA Edu 2022.1.3 includes the latest updates from IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition and EduTools 2022.7.

Here are the highlights:
  • Added helpful guides for configuring your working environment.
  • Enabled the Marketplace login widget for educational courses in Course Creator mode.
  • Fixed the issue preventing the next task from opening when Peek Solution is enabled.

See all the fixes and improvements for this version in our issue tracker.

IntelliJ IDEA Edu 2021.3.4 includes the latest updates from IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition 2021.3.3 and EduTools 2022.3.

Here are the highlights:

  • When starting the Scala Tutorial for the first time, the IDE will now suggest installing the Scala plugin.

IntelliJ IDEA Edu 2020.3.4 is now out.

  • Improvements for JetBrains Academy:
    • "Solve in IDE" action for code problems now loads all code problems from the corresponding topic along with the topic's theory.
    • Fixed encoding/decoding of git object files when navigating between stages in "Git Internals" project.
    • Updated default "build.gradle" files.
  • Supported custom commands for "Run" button in theory tasks.
  • Improvements for Codeforces:
    • Auto-substitution of input for Run/Debug for Go and Rust.
    • Correctly parse line breaks in sample input/output.
  • Improvements for the Course Selection View:
    • Courses opened outside of the Course Selection View are added to "My Courses".
    • Fixed "C/C++ courses are not supported" error for Stepik and Codeforces C++ courses.
    • Fixes for "Restart/Remove Course" actions.
    • Fixed exception caused by having default non-English locale.

Check out this blog post for more information.

PhpStorm 2023.1 EAP #2 is now available



Read the blog post to learn about the following updates already available to try in this EAP build:

  • Scanning files to index in smart mode.
  • A new IDE suggestion to reconfigure Windows Defender settings for better performance.
  • Descriptions for file open modes in the completion popup.
  • A couple of new live templates for PHP.


The full list of changes in this build is available in the release notes.

PhpStorm 2022.3.2 is now available



The second bug-fix update for PhpStorm 2022.3 is now available. This release brings a bunch of bug fixes and quality-of-life improvements.

Notable changes:

  • Settings Sync: plugins will not be synced between IDEs by default [IDEA-307136]
  • Support 'JavaScript Standard Style' version 17 (https://standardjs.com/) [WEB-55664]
  • Fixed: Angular 14: High CPU usage when using instanceof FormGroup [WEB-56411]
  • Fixed: Close icon become visible for the wrong tab [IDEA-272466]
  • Fixed: Running Behat feature steps from gutter creates Cucumber.js run configuration instead of Behat [WI-70062]
  • Fixed: Method call isn't resolved to related trait if the same method included in class using mixin [WI-65196]
  • Fixed: Quick Documentation: Doesn't show the constant value [WI-70107]
  • Fixed: PHP_CodeSniffer validation Inspections don't apply custom severity highlighting [WI-54652]
  • Fixed: Quality Tools: Changing custom severity in `Show warning as` breaks saving of all subsequent changes in PHPCS settings [WI-70156]
  • Fixed: ParaTest: Helpers bootstrap overrides bootstrap from phpunit.xml [WI-70273]
  • Fixed: ParaTest doesn't work when PhpUnit configuration file is being used as test scope [WI-70496]


For the full list of changes in this build, please see the release notes.

PhpStorm 2022.2.4 is now available



Changes included in this update:

  • Fixed: Unsupported LanguageLevel in LanguageLevelTypeAware WI-68761
  • Fixed: SIGSEGV on macOS JBR-4856 
  • Fixed: Blank IDE when reconnecting second monitor JBR-4897


For the full list of changes in this build, please see the release notes.

PhpStorm 2022.1.4 is now available


The most notable bug fixes in this build include:

  • Fixed: Git commit description: blinking text [IDEA-284246]
  • Fixed: "Run Git hooks" checkbox becomes disabled after the first Commit action, no Git pre-commit hooks are executed [IDEA-264817]

PhpStorm 2021.3.3 is now available

  • Fixed: Currently active result tab gets removed when attempting to remove others (IDEA-274154)

Rider 2022.3.2 bug-fix release has just arrived. Let’s take a look at the most important updates.

Performance

Searching in the Search Everywhere popup shouldn’t be slow anymore (IDEA-308324).

Code editor

The Undo action works as expected in files with language injections (RIDER-85801). 

Web development 

  • Hot reload applies layout changes in ASP.NET Core MVC applications on macOS (RIDER-69650).
  • You can again build a web application that uses a legacy project style from the classic .NET Framework with the embedded MSBuild (RIDER-87113).
  • We fixed the crash in ASP.NET Core projects (RSRP-490776).

Unreal Engine support

  • The upcoming changes in UnrealHeaderTool and Blueprints from Unreal Engine 5.2 are now supported.
  • We fixed several issues that caused excessive memory usage in C++ solutions – Unreal Engine projects in particular.

Debugger

The Options and Hide buttons stay on the Debug window’s toolbar after you disable the new UI (RIDER-84418).

C# support

We fixed the false-positive errors for BigInteger operators in .NET 7 (RSRP-490798).

F# support 

The #r "nuget: PackageName" directive in F# script files is being resolved correctly again (RIDER-86308).

For the full list of fixed issues, please refer to this page.

The Rider 2022.2.4 bug-fix release has just arrived. Let's take a look at the most important updates.

  • Fixed the CVE 2022-41032 vulnerability Microsoft recently uncovered in .NET 7.0.0-rc.1, .NET 6.0, .NET Core 3.1, and NuGet clients (NuGet.exe, NuGet.Commands, NuGet.CommandLine, and NuGet.Protocol).
  • Fixed an error that was preventing Rider from building projects that target Unreal Engine 5.1 Preview on macOS (RIDER-83762).
  • Fixed an error causing Rider to interfere with the processing of T4 text templates in Microsoft Visual Studio (RIDER-80838).

For the full list of fixes, please refer to our issue tracker.

• We fixed the Windows Authentication for the SQL Server (DBE-15456)
  • We fixed the metadata for the Unity plugin – the plugin DLL no longer returns errors (RIDER-76619).

Rider for Unreal Engine 2022.1 preview build is here!

Here are the highlights:

  • Unreal Engine
    • Support for Unreal Engine unit testing is now enabled on macOS and Linux.
    • You can now open the engine without a game project (or with several projects) in Rider. Just select the Unreal Engine root folder or the UE4Games.uprojectdirs file when choosing a project to open.
    • We added support for reloading dependent modules when the .Build.cs file has been changed and the project is opened via .uproject file (RIDER-63077).
    • We reduced the load time of the project properties window. Now only the selected configuration tab's content is loaded (RIDER-36014).
    • We added support for Unreal Engine 5 built-in preprocessor macros in the .Build.cs and .Target.cs files (RIDER-45134).
    • Rider no longer suggests C# features that are too modern in the .Build.cs and .Target.cs files on Unreal Engine 4 (RIDER-72371).
    • Rider now reads the list of valid reflection specifiers directly from the currently used version of Unreal Engine, so it offers you only applicable items in code completion and shows up-to-date documentation.
  • UnrealLink/RiderLink
    • The Refresh project action is available on the toolbar to regenerate Visual Studio project files (only for .sln).
    • New actions Extract RiderLink plugin to Game and Extract RiderLink plugin to Engine are now available via Find Actions and the File | Settings | Languages & Frameworks | Unreal Engine menu. If RiderLink fails to build, or if you don't want to build RiderLink right away, you can use Extract RiderLink, which will skip the compilation of RiderLink and will simply extract its source code into your project.
    • We implemented several Unreal log panel fixes and UX improvements (RIDER-68827).
  • Debugger
    • Fixed a variety of issues causing crashes.
    • Fixed reading PDB files from network paths.
    • Fixed global hex presentation on Windows

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2021.3.1 update is here!

While we planned for Rider for Unreal Engine 2021.3 to be the last separate build for Unreal Engine development, we decided to publish a new bug-fix update to address a few critical UI freezes reported by our users. This includes the following fixes:

  • Memory consumption on the frontend no longer leads to UI freezes:
    • During code highlighting (RIDER-7297).
    • During code navigation (RIDER-72539).
    • While displaying code hints (RIDER-72698).
    • In other cases (RIDER-73194).
  • Unreal Engine support:
    • Numerous fixes for Blueprint parsing.
    • Fixed Rider showing successfully passed unit tests as failed in UE5.
    • Unreal log filter configuration is now preserved between launches, and other fixes for the UnrealLink/RiderLink pair of plugins.

What's coming next? The Rider 2022.1 EAP will include Unreal Engine support merged from Rider for Unreal Engine.

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2021.2.1 update is here!

The highlights include:

  • Unreal Engine Automation Testing framework support. Read our blog post for more details, known limitations, etc.
  • .uproject model support:
    • Rider now adds new files to the .uproject project model when they are created on the disk.
    • Rider no longer fails when opening .uproject in a clean project with a relative path to the engine (RIDER-61964).
    • Fixed issues with loading .uproject on macOS (RIDER-66436).
    • Fixed issues with calling UnrealBuildTool from Rider (RIDER-66160).
  • Debugger enhancements:
    • Fixed several issues leading to extremely high memory consumption (RIDER-67064).
    • On macOS pretty printers are now imported automatically (RIDER-66212).

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2021.1.3 update is here!

This update brings more fixes for Unreal Engine 5 projects and unveils our debugger overhaul, which significantly improves the way variables are rendered in the debugger.

  • Improved Natvis support
    • Support for Inheritable attribute, format specifiers, CustomListItems.
    • Better built-in renderers.
  • A fix for the incorrect rendering of the tuple collection (especially critical for the TTuple, TVariant, and TArray types with non-standard allocators).
  • Fixes for Unreal Engine 5.

Read on for more details in our blog.

  • In UnrealLink/RiderLink plugin:
    • The plugin is now hosted on JetBrains Marketplace,
      so we can now update it independently from the Rider for Unreal Engine release cycle.
    • Fixed build issues for UE 4.23 and earlier.
    • Fixed UI freezes when there are too many messages in the Unreal log panel.
  • In general C++ support:
    • Fixed an issue with the Switch Header/Source action
      sometimes not working properly when a preview panel is open.
    • Fixed an issue with the Go to file member action
      which behaves incorrectly in UE sources when Treat Unreal Engine symbols as non-project is on.
  • In Blueprints integration:
    • We have some reports about high memory use and performance issues caused by the Blueprints integration.
      While we are investigating the root cause of this, you can temporarily disable Blueprints support
      in File | Settings | Languages & Frameworks | C++ | Unreal Engine settings.

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

Rider for Unreal Engine Public Preview 2020.1.3 update is here!

Here are some of the main highlights:

  • Experimental support for the Unreal Engine project model is introduced.
    • Enable it with File | Settings | Languages & Frameworks | C++ | Unreal Engine | [Experimental] Use Unreal Engine project model.
    • When opening a solution in this mode, Rider will take the modules-structured information about defines, include paths,
      and (starting from UE 4.25) PCH force includes from UBT instead of the .vcxproj files.
    • This guarantees correct coding assistance (like code completion or navigation) for configurations other than the default (Development Editor | Win64).
  • Fixes for the RiderLink/UnrealLink plugins:
    • RiderLink is now installed into the Engine itself instead of a game project. During the installation process,
      the plugin will be built and put into the correct folder, and a progress bar now appears when installing the plugin.
    • An option was added to compile the game before starting PIE from Rider.
    • The plugin no longer breaks the compilation of Unreal Engine projects in Rider.
  • Debugger enhancements and fixes:
    • Debug session no longer freezes on stop. (This happened when the target process spawned another child process that was later detached.)
    • A bug when child members weren't shown for some values is now fixed.
    • Threads are now named automatically based on their entry-point function.
    • Debugger got significant performance improvements, many freezes and crashes were fixed.
    • Fixes for stepping issues in multithreaded code, fixes for floating point type variables and arguments, and much more.
  • Fixes for the "Navigate to the derived symbols" action and auto-import invoked on enum or typedef.
  • Fixes for the incorrect window autoscroll when typing and editor crash in some cases.

Learn more about Rider for Unreal Engine.

WebStorm 2023.1 EAP #3 is now available!

What's new:

  • Initial Astro support available via a plugin
  • New UI enhancements
  • Docker improvements

For more details, please see the blog post.

WebStorm 2022.3.2 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • We've introduced a new option to the Settings Sync solution to enable and disable syncing between different IDEs (IDEA-233535).
  • We've added support for ESLint flat config (WEB-57661).
  • We've fixed the issue with JavaScript Standard Style 17 (WEB-55664).
  • We've made several Prisma support improvements (WEB-58853, WEB-58852, and WEB-58854).
  • We've fixed the issue causing StackOverflowException errors when clicking TypeScript variables inside .vue and .ts files (WEB-58899).
  • We've added fixes to cover new cases with the screen flickering in full-screen mode on macOS Ventura (JBR-4959).
  • Opening the terminal using a custom shortcut or a non-default keymap no longer causes unnecessary symbols to be printed in the command prompt (IDEA-307583).
  • Close icons are no longer displayed for non-closable tabs in the Run/Debug tool window (IDEA-272466).
  • The detached IDE window no longer disappears on restart if there's no open file in the main window (IDEA-304518).

For more details, please see the blog post.

WebStorm 2022.2.4 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • We've fixed the issue causing WebStorm to highlight the Tailwind CSS @config directive as an error (WEB-57766).

For more details, please see the blog post.

WebStorm 2022.1.4 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • WebStorm no longer crashes on macOS High Sierra (IDEA-296489).
  • Fixed the Run Git hooks checkbox in the Before Commit section of the Commit tool window (IDEA-264817).
  • Fixed the issue causing the external diff tools for directories to malfunction (IDEA-295565).
  • Fixed the issue causing text flickers in the Commit details pane (IDEA-264817).

For more details, please see the blog post.

WebStorm 2021.3.3 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • Fixed the issue causing the IDE to freeze and hang when indexing WSL projects (IDEA-286059).
  • Tailwind CSS code completion will work if your package.json, node-modules, and tailwind.config.js files are located in a subfolder (WEB-48964).
  • WebStorm will automatically find a Prettier package installed globally using NVM (WEB-54501).
  • Fixed the behavior on macOS when switching between Big Sur tabs (IDEA-261595).
  • Solved the problem causing the IDE to add unexpected refs / heads prefixes when pushing to Gerrit (IDEA-282180).

For more details, please see the blog post.

WebStorm 2021.2.4 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • Changed the behavior and implementation of the Trusted Projects feature.
  • In Sass, WebStorm will correctly resolve @use and @import statements without a tilde (WEB-53120).
  • The spellchecker now understands Italian words with apostrophes (IDEA-246846).
  • Unexpected empty windows should no longer appear when switching between Git branches (IDEA-277226).

For more details, please see the blog post.

WebStorm 2021.1.3 is now available!

What's fixed:

  • Fixed the issue with the debugger not reconnecting automatically (WEB-50455).
  • Fixed the regression bug causing the Stretch to Right / Stretch to Left actions not to work as expected (IDEA-267294).
  • Fixed the bug causing the Compare with branch dialog to close unexpectedly (IDEA-251381).
  • Solved the problem with images not being rendered in the Documentation popup (IDEA-256001).

For more details, please see the blog post.

WebStorm 2020.3.3 is now available!

  • Fixed the bug with Git diff changes shown incorrectly (IDEA-257651).
